intro: Blackstonia acuminata var. aestiva, commonly known as the summer blackstonia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partially shaded to sunny conditions. Its botanical features include small, leathery leaves and clusters of pale pink to white blossoms that bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden environments.
